alert.note: Alert for Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 12:48PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY... ...GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY... .An Arctic air mass will continue to support dangerously cold wind chills over western South Dakota and northeastern Wyoming through the week. The coldest wind chills are expected to occur Wednesday through Friday, as a quick-moving storm system crosses the region. This system will also bring a quick shot of snow, which, combined with strong northwest winds, could lead to significant blowing of snow. As a result, ground blizzard conditions will be possible Wednesday through early Friday, especially over the South Dakota plains. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, ground blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Harding County, Perkins County, Butte County, the Northern Meade County Plains and Ziebach County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 PM MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel. Widespread blowing snow could create ground blizzard conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means falling and blowing snow with strong winds may produce dangerous whiteout conditions. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach
